newsitem.title: MOROCCO: PRESS DIGEST - Morocco economic weeklies - June 20.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Morocco economic weeklies - June 20.

text.p: These are the leading stories in Morocco's economic press. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Japanese bank Nomura buys 10 percent stake worth $80 million in Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur. The stake was previously held by Caisse de Depot et de Gestion (CDG).
- The 1997-98 finance law should be passed with no significant changes despite businessmen worries about taxation penalties whose application are expected to start in July.
- Central bank turns down banks offers for weekly treasury bills for third consecutive week which might be sign that it aims at pushing them to lower interest rates.
- Morocco's stock exchange, which is keeping a downward trend since April might go lower after distribution of companies dividends by the end of June.
